result.execSummary:
The defendant James D. Marshall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Consecutive to: consecutive to all other counts and cases.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with firearms/dangerous weapons.
Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.

No contact with victim or her minor child, including during period of initial confinement. Court or agent can modify contact during extended supervision period.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

Batterers Intervention program. 
Cognitive Thinking Class.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
DNA Sample WAIVED, previously provided.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James D. Marshall in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant James D. Marshall in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. Received & Filed, Victim Impact Statement -reviewed by the court.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 7 YEARS, consecutive to all other counts and cases, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 3 YEARS & 6 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS & 6 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Batterers Intervention program. 
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Cognitive Thinking Class.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-No contact with firearms/dangerous weapons.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim or her minor child, including during period of initial confinement. Court or agent can modify contact during extended supervision period.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-DNA Sample WAIVED, previously provided.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Received & Filed, State's Sentencing Memorandum.

Defendant James D. Marshall in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant James D. Marshall in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 1 AMENDED To remove the Repeater enhancer 939.62(1)(b).
AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED 
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 2 Dismissed, But Read In.
 
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. Court VACATED JURY TRIAL DATE. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Br. 23 is in trial, case spun to Judge Dallet, branch 40.

ADA DeSiato and Defense Attorney Kuehn in court to request matter be set for a plea date, prior to Jury Trial date of 6/22/2015 at 8:30 AM. Case remains set for Jury Trial and is set for a Plea Hearing on 6/16/2015 at 8:30 AM in branch 23. Parties advised of court calendar constraints. State advised court it will produce defendant from the Wisconsin State Prison system.
Received & Filed, State's Requested Jury Instructions.
Received & Filed, State's Witness List.

Defendant James D. Marshall in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant James D. Marshall in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial. Discussion regarding joinder of 15CF1552, 14CF5700, and 15CF426. Arguments form state and defense. For reasons placed on the record the court GRANTED joinder of all three matters for Jury Trial. Discussion regarding Jury Trial dates. Court ordered all cases transfered to branch 23. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Discussion and argument from defendant and state as to defendant's PRO SE motion to dismiss, DENIED by the court. Matters remain set for Jury Trial on 6/22/2015 at 8:30 AM in branch 23.

Defendant James D. Marshall in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn. Defendant James D. Marshall in custody.  Molly M Schmidt for Abbey DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Status Conference with pending case set fro Continued Preliminary hearing. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND on case 15CF1552. State to provide discovery to defense counsel by 10:00 AM on 06/01/2015. Case set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial dates. Defendant ordered produced for both hearings. Court to address joinder of 15CF1552, 14CF5700 & 15CF426 on date of Final Pretrial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case set for a Status Conference. Attorney Kuehn in branch 03, unable to appear. Court adjourned matter to 5/28/2015 at 1:30 PM.

Defendant James D. Marshall in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant James D. Marshall in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Status Conference with pending matter set for Preliminary Hearing. Case passed. Case Recalled.  Case adjourned with pending case for Status Conference in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James D. Marshall in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant James D. Marshall in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's new case preliminary hearing was adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Letter to the court.

Defendant James D. Marshall in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant James D. Marshall in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for status conference with pending case set for Preliminary HEaring. Defense Counsel advised court there has been a breakdown in the attorney-client relationship, and requested to withdraw. Court GRANTED withdraw of Attorney Goodrich as counsel in this matter. Defendant advised of and WAIVED time limits as to the Preliminary Hearing to allow new counsel to be appointed. This matter set for Status of Counsel date date and with pending cases in branch 23. Court will address state's motion for joinder of 14CF5700, 15CF426 & 15CF1552 for trial, and transfer of 14CF5700 & 15CF426 to branch 23. Speedy Trial Demand remains in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23.  
  Status conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James D Marshall in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant James D Marshall in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is currently serving a revocation sentence.  Defendant has a new case (2015CF1552), set for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-20-2015 at 8:30 am.  Today's date, the Court vacates the Speedy Trial and ordered cases 2014CF5700 and 2015CF426, adjourned for a Status Conference in Branch 4 on 4-20-2015 at 8:30 am.  Court ordered that the cash bond on both cases 2014CF5700 are converted to a signature bond in the amount of $7,500.00 and 2015CF426 is converted to a signature bond in the amount of $25,000.00.   mld
STATE'S MOTION TO ADMIT SARA SCHNECK'S AND TL'S (7/5/01) TESTIMONIAL STATEMENTS UNDER FORFEITURE BY WRONGDOING
and Supporting Memorandum of Law to Admit 911 Recording, from the State, received and filed.   mld
Rescinding Defendant's Telephone, Visitation, and U.S. Mail Custody Privileges, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant James D. Marshall in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant James D. Marshall in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  All discovery materials on case 2015CF426 were turned over to defense counsel by the State.  Global offer on the two cases will be forwarded to defense counsel, per the State. 

Speedy Trial is currently scheduled in Branch 4 on 4-13-2015 at 8:30 am, for case 2014CF5700.  Upon the motion of the State, the Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial: Cases 2014CF5700 and 2015CF426.  Both the State and defense are not requesting a new date for trial.  

Based on the new charges, the Motion of the State for an Order Rescinding Defendant's Telephone, Visitation, and U.S. Mail Custody Privileges, was heard and granted by the Court.   Defense was opposed to Order.   

The Motions of the State to Admit 911 Tape and Forfeiture by Wrong Doing are to be filed with the court by 3-2-2015.  Reply by defendant is due 3-23-2015.

Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 4-13-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TL dob 7/1/01; Sara S. and of of Sara S's children

Defendant James D. Marshall in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant James D. Marshall in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
